questions.question_text: An SCCP IP phone places a call to a SIP phone that is registered to the same Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express. During the active call, call waiting indicates a second call is incoming to the handset, but the user decides to ignore it. In this scenario, what is the combined total number of signaling conversations and media flows that used the SCCP phone as an endpoint?

discussion.content:
We need to think in terms of CUCME for SIP or SCCP. i.e 3 signals 
if the CUCM/E call signaling is completed, between the phones there is only RTP.

What they mean by the "handset"? The SIP phone or the SCCP one? If SIP it would be 2 (active call signalling + media) but if SCCP then 3 (active call media and signalling + signalling of the second one). Am I right or not?

why 3? No mention anywhere that the call is forwarded
1 for incoming call,
2 for second incoming call

questions.question_text: Which configuration causes PSTN users to experience a fail tone for every other call when trying to reach a particular number on Cisco Unified CME?

choices.B: Duplicate ephone-dn is not assigned to the ephone.
choices.A: ephone-dn is not assigned to the ephone.
choices.D: ephone does not exist for the ephone-dn.

discussion.content: "Every other" means that first call is answered by phone A but when someone calls when A is busy second calls fails. (it would require shared line aka same extension assigned to another phone)

choices.C: Cisco Unified Communications Manager auto registration is disabled.
choices.A: Cisco Unified Communications Manager is unable to reach user IP phone.
choices.B: Cisco Unified Communications Manager database replication status is 2.
choices.E: Cisco Unified Communications Manager subscriber is offline.
choices.D: Cisco Unified Communications Manager is unable to allocate DN.

discussion.content: ccnanow , Because the phone would not even try to register if auto-reg was disabled
Why would this not be auto registration turned off

questions.question_text: Which Cisco Unified Communications Manager configuration causes an IP phone screen to display a "registration rejected" message?
An end user reports that conference calls are failing. Which fault domain should be investigated first?

choices.B: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Media Resources

discussion.content: B. Cisco Unified Communications Manager Media Resources

questions.question_text: Which port is the default port for SCCP call signaling on Cisco Unified Communications Manager?

discussion.content: The answer is A. TCP port 2000
